page.title: 20TOURISM/CONTRIBUTING SCHOOLS
page.content: {Holbeche House}(where the Gunpowder Plotters were eventually captured) and the{Glass Museum}( part of the Black Country Heritage Trail ) are the main places of interest. The Museum was opened in 1980 by Princess Michael of Kent. It illustrates glass making from Roman times, especially Wordsley and Stourbridge glass from the past 400 years. Also shown are etching and engraving. Visitors from all over the world come to see this priceless collection. {CONTRIBUTING SCHOOLS.} {Primary:}Bromley Hills, Church of the Ascension, Dawley Brook, St. Mark's, St. Mary's, Blanford Mere. {Secondary:}The Crestwood School, The Kingswinford School.
